pullRequest.body:
Based on @eric-wieser's comment at https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23324#discussion_r2014688006. Induction principles to rename were found using the regex `^\s+\| @?[Hh]_`.

Most of this PR just removes `h_` from the start of induction branch names that start with it, but `MeasureTheory.SimpleFunc.induction` and `DirectSum.induction_(l)on` receive more substantial changes, and the motive variables have been renamed to `motive` as per the naming conventions.

### PR summary [8af387ae64](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23358/commits/8af387ae640ef7833b69325d296bb0fe94d9c48a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`-+-+ induction`
`--++ induction_on'`
`---+++ induction_on`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors merge

Thanks!

>  Induction principles to rename were found using the regex `^\s+\| @?[Hh]_.`

I think there's probably a second batch with no `_` to go through as well, but that's for another PR.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/14140134078/job/39619994743)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/14140134078/job/39619994873)
Thanks, this is great! Just a few more tweaks.

```suggestion
    (add :  x y, C x  C y  C (x + y)) : C x := by
```

```suggestion
    (of :  (i : ) (x :  i), C (of  i x))
```

You can declare it out of scope for this PR, but the naming guide says
```suggestion
protected theorem induction_on {motive : ( i,  i)  Prop} (x :  i,  i) (zero : motive 0)
```
and since you're modifying these lines anyway...
Maybe `const` would be a better name here
OK. I have implemented all your proposed changes.

```suggestion
protected theorem Decomposition.inductionOn {motive : M  Prop} (zero : p 0)
```
and for the other ones in this PR
Ready now.

```suggestion
    (indicatorConst :
```

```suggestion
    (isClosed : IsClosed { f : Lp E p  | P f }) :  f : Lp E p , P f := by
```
since we're renaming this anyway

```suggestion
    (indicatorConst :  (c : E) {s : Set } (hs : MeasurableSet s) (hs :  s < ),
```

```suggestion
    (indicator :  (c : E) s, MeasurableSet s   s <   motive (s.indicator fun _ => c))
```
here too

```suggestion
@[elab_as_elim]
protected theorem Decomposition.inductionOn {motive : M  Prop} (zero : motive 0)
```

```suggestion
@[elab_as_elim]
theorem smul_induction {motive : Word M  Prop} (empty : motive empty)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: review of induction branch names
